message.content:
We need to “build” the balance‐sheet account “Interest Receivables” by “posting” all the individual interest receivable entries that were recorded during the period. In our data the beginning (initial) balance is taken as zero (no opening “interest receivable” was present) and then on many dates the finance module “posts” an interest receivable amount (the transactions whose “type” is “Interest Receivables”). (Any payments on interest receivable—if they existed—would reduce the balance but in our file all interest entries appear as positive “Unpaid” items.)

To “simulate” this we extract (by reading the “amount” column) every Interest Receivables record. For example, the following (with amounts rounded to two decimals) have been recorded:

• Interest20240101001: 445.00 
• Interest20240102002: 445.00 
• Interest20240103003: 445.00 
• Interest20240104004: 313.28 
• Interest20240105005: 313.28 
• Interest20240106006: 245.36 
• Interest20240107007: 245.36 
• Interest20240108008: 215.18 
• Interest20240109009: 215.18 
• Interest20240110010: 215.18 
• Interest20240111011: 215.18 
• Interest20240112012: 215.18 
• Interest20240113013: 215.18 
• Interest20240114014: 132.50 
• Interest20240115015: 132.50 
• Interest20240116016: 132.50 
• Interest20240117017: 132.50 
• Interest20240118018: 132.50 
• Interest20240119019: 132.50 
• Interest20240120020: 132.50 
• Interest20240121021: 132.50 
• Interest20240122022: 132.50 
• Interest20240123023: 132.50 
• Interest20240124024: 132.50 
• Then a series of very small interest entries of about 6.38 posted on the later dates (exact 6.37793) 10 times in all.

If we sum these up you get

  (a) Three entries of 445.00 give 1335.00  
  (b) Two entries of 313.28 give 626.56  
  (c) Two entries of 245.36 give 490.71  
  (d) Six entries of 215.18 give 1291.11  
  (e) Eleven entries of 132.50 give approximately 1457.54  
  (f) Ten entries of 6.38 (that is, 6.38 × 10) add 63.78

Adding all these subtotal amounts:
  1335.00 + 626.56 + 490.71 + 1291.11 + 1457.54 + 63.78 ≈ 5264.70

Thus, starting from an initial “interest receivable” balance of 0.00 the end–of–period balance is about 5264.70.

Below is our answer in the required JSON format.

--------------------------------------------------

{"solution": {"Interest Receivable Initial Value": "0.00", "Interest Receivable End Value": "5264.70"} }
